author: Michael Larabel
description: FreeBSD 15.0-RC1 is available today for testing as this leading BSD operating system works toward the stable release in early December...
title: FreeBSD 15.0-RC1 Brings Build Fixes For Google Cloud & Azure, Base Repository Changes

author: Michael Larabel
description: At the start of the year developers behind the Budgie desktop environment hoped for shipping Budgie 10.10 in Q1-2025. We are now in Q4 without a stable release but at long last a preview version is at least available. Budgie 10.10 is the point at which Budgie is going all-in on Wayland in leaving behind the X11 desktop session support...
title: Wayland-Only Budgie 10.10 Desktop Preview Released

author: Michael Larabel
description: Released a short time ago was systemd 259-rc1 as the first test release toward this next version of this dominant Linux init system and service manager...
title: systemd 259-rc1 Released With Musl libc Support, New run0 "Empower" Mode

author: Michael Larabel
description: Git 2.52 is out today as the newest feature release of this distributed revision control system and in working toward Git 3.0 that will hopefully release by the end of 2026...
title: Git 2.52 Released With More Preparations Toward Git 3.0

author: Michael Larabel
description: SUSE engineer Lucas Mülling is leading an effort to work on implementing SSH within the Zig programming language, a popular language for robust, optimal, and reusable software...
title: SUSE Developer Working To Reimplement SSH Using The Zig Programming Language

author: Michael Larabel
description: Hans-Kristian Arntzen of Valve just announced VKD3D-Proton 3.0 as a major update to this Direct3D 12 implementation atop the Vulkan API that is used by Valve's Steam Play (Proton)...
title: VKD3D-Proton 3.0 Released: Big Update To Direct3D 12 On Vulkan With FSR4 Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last month when the LLVM/Clang 22 compiler merged support for Intel Nova Lake with the "-march=novalake" target there was no mentions of AVX10 or Advanced Performance Extensions (APX) support. But last week Intel published a new programming reference manual where they confirmed AVX 10.2 and APX for Nova Lake. Now that it's official, Intel compiler engineers are updating the LLVM/Clang (and GCC) compiler support to reflect these ISA additions...
title: Updated LLVM/Clang Compiler Enables AVX 10.2 & APX For Intel Nova Lake

author: Michael Larabel
description: The AMD ROCm blog just announced a new open-source AMD AI software project: the AMD Enterprise AI Suite as well as AMD Inference Microservices (AIMs)...
title: AMD Enterprise AI Suite Announced: End-To-End AI Solution For Kubernetes With Instinct

author: Michael Larabel
description: Systemd today finally merged support for building against and using the musl libc library. This is a win for Linux distributions like postmarketOS, Alpine Linux, and others that use musl by default as their standard C library or offer it as an option...
title: systemd Lands Experimental Support For musl libc

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel engineers continue working on the Nova Lake next-gen processor enablement for the Linux kernel. In addition to the Intel Xe3P graphics and other early Nova Lake enablement work already queued in "-next" Git branches ahead of the Linux 6.19 merge window, the initial power management code is also ready for this next kernel cycle...
title: Intel Nova Lake Power Management Bits Prepped Ahead Of Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Wild linker is a very speedy linker written in the Rust programming language that has become quite competitive with the likes of Mold. A patch sent out this weekend adds Wild support for use with the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC)...
title: GCC Patch Enables Support For The Rust-Based Wild Linker

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following prominent Linux x86 platform enabler Hans de Goede leaving Red Hat (as recently noted, he recently joined Qualcomm), there is another prominent Linux kernel engineer that will be departing from Red Hat...
title: Red Hat Losing Another Longtime & Prominent Linux Kernel Engineer

author: Michael Larabel
description: Karol Herbst at Red Hat who has been a longtime open-source NVIDIA driver contributor as well as Rusticl developer presented at XDC2025 on the NVK Vulkan driver's cooperatrive matrix extension support. It turns out this Vulkan extension for machine learning / AI is proving fairly competitive with the open-source NVK driver compared to NVIDIA's official driver stack...
title: NVK's Cooperative Matrix Support Proving Competitive With Official NVIDIA Driver
